page.title: 11HARGRAVE LODGE FARM
page.content: Hargrave Lodge Farm is owned by Mr and Mrs Topham.The farm has 250 acres of land but only 90 acres are used for growing. The land is mainly used for growing wheat and barley. Mr Topham has been farming for over 20 years although his family has been working on that land for 42 years. The farm has some cows, poultry and horses. They have several different breeds of horses. They have a friesan bull and rear beef cattle which they send to market. In the house they have 2 gold- fish, a dog, 8 cats and a few kittens. The farm animals cost over a hundred pounds a day to feed. The animals eat sugar beet pulp, grass, hay, bran, fruit and barley. The farm is thought to be over 100 years old. There are only two workers on the farm, they are Mr Topham and his daughter Tracey. They start work at 8am and finish at 6pm.
